Classes

The following classes are available globally.

  • ASLObject

    Instances of the ASLObject class provide type-safe to an underlying asl_object_t of a given ASL_TYPE.

    Typically, you would interact one of the ASLObject subclasses: ASLMessageObject or ASLQueryObject. However, you can also use low-level ASL functionality using the asl_object_t exposed by the aslObject property.

    Note: ASLObject subclass implementations are only provided for ASL_TYPE_MSG (the ASLMessageObject class) and ASL_TYPE_QUERY (the ASLQueryObject class).

    See more

    Declaration

    Swift

    public class ASLObject
  • ASLMessageObject

    Represents an ASL message object.

    Message objects represent an asl_object_t having a type of ASL_TYPE_MSG.

    See more

    Declaration

    Swift

    public final class ASLMessageObject: ASLObject
  • ASLQueryObject

    Represents an ASL query object.

    Message objects represent an asl_object_t having a type of ASL_TYPE_QUERY.

    See more

    Declaration

    Swift

    public final class ASLQueryObject: ASLObject
  • ASLClient

    ASLClient instances maintain a client connection to the ASL daemon, and can used to perform logging and to execute log search queries.

    Note: Because the underlying client connection is not intended to be shared across threads, each ASLClient has an associated GCD serial queue used to ensure that the underlying ASL client connection is only ever used from a single thread.

    See more

    Declaration

    Swift

    public final class ASLClient
